answers.answer: A PFO should not cause enlargement of the right side of your heart but an atrial septal defect could or blood clots to the lung.  With you being overweight the possibility of sleep apnea should be considered.  It looks like you are getting a good work up.

question: I had been having chest pains and sought medical attention and have received a number of test.  My Cholesterol and triglycerides are within normal range. My BP is managed by 1/2 Lisinopril 20/25 daily and I take Metformin 100 mg 2X daily due to diabetes.  The test that have been completed include a nuclear stress test, TEE, CT Scan and a Cardiac catheterization just last Wednesday.  I'm now scheduled for an MRI on 11-10-08.My Question:  What has caused the enlargement of the right side of my heart.  The Doc first thought a PFO.  I have a PFO with R > L shunting but not L > R.  Congenital defects of my coronary arteries has been ruled out.  I'm two months shy of my 50th birthday, about 25 pounds over weight and have no other know health difficulties.
title: Just diagones that the right side of my heart is enlarged.
